website_summaries.verdict: It's not the cheapest ladder out there, but it is durable and will last for years.
pros: Easy to open and close, lightweight and stores easily
cons: Maximum weight of 225 pounds may be a problem for some people

customer_reviews.title: Nice top storage platform tray.
customer_reviews.text: Nice sturdy step stool ladder that easily holds more than the weight rating of 235 lbs. Top platform is only for holding tools, wash bucket, or a paint can. Nice deep slip resistant treads easily hold my size 12 feet securely. Step stool does slide slightly on smooth surfaces but won't once you put your fell weight on it. Locks into folding or climbing positions. Storage Deck has holes & slots for screwdrivers, paint brushes, & other tools. Very secure climbing! PS. USPS would not deliver it, had to pick it up @ the postal office!
customer_reviews.author: Russell R. Herman

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, is stable
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, is stable,but very stiff and stubborn to open. Closes easily enough with the lift up handle, but have to do the tango with the darn thing to get it open. Just ok....after struggling with this ladder I decided to get a different kind that is easier to use....I bought a Flip-n-Lite which works like a dream! It is sturdy, really lightweight, has a clip release that opens the ladder quickly & easily. Wish I had paid up and purchased the more expensive (but well worth it) Flip-N-Lite from the beginning. This Cosco ladder will go to Habitat. Someone who doesn't mind the struggle will love it.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: This is a bargain for a good step ladder. It's not very heavy, but it is very sturdy. I purchased it to reach the windshield and top of my pick-up truck but we have found it useful for lots of other things such as cleaning ceiling fans, putting items on high shelves, hanging art and decorating the top of the Christmas tree. As if that was not enough, the shelf at the top is a great place for a cat nap :-).
customer_reviews.author: Gayle McDonald

customer_reviews.title: I like it but.....
customer_reviews.text: I like the ladder as the steps are comfy on bare feet. BUT..the paint tray is dead center of the bar across the top and so...you cant really dip your brush in without hitting the bar. The ladder is harder to fold up than my last costco ladder and you must be careful when folding up cause you dont have space from tray to bar without getting fingers caught and injured. poor design there too. and the legs are not that sturdy on medium pile carpet... I want my old ladder back because this one isnt as good as my old one.
customer_reviews.author: Dogmom328

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny
customer_reviews.text: This ladder paid for itself the first time I used it. I'm a 69 year old woman afraid of heights, but had to change a light bulb (happens all the time). This was inside a ceiling fan light. I could climb the wide steps on the ladder easily, hold on to the handle, and see inside the fixture without having to take the glass cover off. Just reached inside, took out the burned out bulb, and replaced it. Paying a handyman would have cost at least a portion of the ladder, and I will use it for years to come, God willing! Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Sister Carol

customer_reviews.title: Great Ladder
customer_reviews.text: I was so unsure about this ladder but it meets all my requirements. Very sturdy/stable, just the right heights, size is perfect. The steps are wide and deep enough for me to feel steady and the construction is just superb. Ive had a cosco ladder for years but it is ony a 2-step ladder so I needed a bit more height. Give it a try!
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Cotter

customer_reviews.title: Very Handy and Easy to Store/Use
customer_reviews.text: I've always had a sturdy 2-step "ladder" in my kitchen and it's great for lots of things but too short to change lightbulbs. I saw this at a friend's house and immediately ordered it when I got home. It still fits next to my fridge and it's easy to handle. Now there's no job that I can't do whether it's reaching on top of the cupboards to clean, change lightbulbs in our recessed lighting or dusting valances. No more lugging the ladder around the house for some things and the short step ladder for other things.
customer_reviews.author: Antics

customer_reviews.title: My favorite go-to step ladder
customer_reviews.text: If you want a light weight, sturdy step ladder this should meet your needs. The shelf at the top of the ladder is perfect for holding a paint can or tools if you're doing work around the house and is my favorite feature of the ladder. This isn't an industrial strength step ladder that will take heavy weights or abusive handling but it is perfect for a light weight ladder to use around the house that takes up minimal storage space, is easy to carry, and very solid.
customer_reviews.author: Bookworm in Boston

customer_reviews.title: This feeble old woman uses this ladder with confidence!
customer_reviews.text: This indoor three-step ladder has been a godsend to me in undertaking to repaint the cabinets and walls in my large kitchen by myself. I can easily move it all over the room, set paint cans and tools securely on the handy tray above the third step, and even reach the 9-foot ceiling to paint the trim up there. I move slowly and carefully, but always feel confident in the stability of my perch. As an added bonus, I leave this ladder set up at all times (though it is easy to fold up and put away) because my cats love to climb it and even eat from the food bowl I put on the tool tray.
customer_reviews.author: patriciawinona

customer_reviews.title: We both love this simple and functional platform
customer_reviews.text: I have to get my cat off the top of it when I need to change the light bulb or curtain. We both love this simple and functional platform.
customer_reviews.author: myrtales

customer_reviews.title: A great value for the money, sturdy, safe and reduces "ladder fatigue"
customer_reviews.text: This is my second unit in the past 15 years and I love them both. This versatile step work platform is not quite as light as my 6' aluminum/fiberglass stepladder but it is a lot more stable. This is perfect for 99% of the interior jobs where I am going to be standing for some time,. The ladder is stable and wide but designed mostly to be on an improved surface, not open ground. The wide steps and stable platform mean you won't get as fatigued as standing on a traditional or rung ladder. The work platform at the top is also very handy with recesses to hold your tools and even a cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: al

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: I am a 72 year old woman who was trying to get her fall cleaning done. I was no longer feeling steady and secure on the step stool I had. I ordered and received this work platform this week and I love it. The steps are nice and deep, the bar along the top helps me steady myself and the shelf is a welcome bonus. Best purchase I've made in a while. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy - not too heavy!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy - not terribly heavy, but it is a ladder - it has to hold your weight! Used this to get to a heavy curtain rod, so that I could just lift one end at a time and slip my curtains on from the end, rather than take the whole rod down. I could rest the heavy curtains on the shelf as I worked. It has already paid for itself with that one chore! Release bar when you are ready to close it up that is so easy to use. Great price - Fast shipping - Great purchase -
customer_reviews.author: leaphighTop Contributor: Cross-Stitch

customer_reviews.title: Why didn’t I buy this sooner...
customer_reviews.text: The platform steps are so comfortable compared to the rungs of my other step ladder. This ladder is so sturdy I feel really safe on it. The tall height makes so many tasks easier. It isn’t too heavy but it is heavier than my other step ladder. It’s a trade off, a little more weight and needs a little more floor space when open but safer, more comfortable, and can reach more places.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Kent

customer_reviews.title: Very slippery on hard surfaces.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Very nice wide steps. I wish all ladders had these. They feel solid and secure. The ladder is a bit heavy but it is pretty large although not that tall. The top platform is for items and not for standing. Cons: The feet are really slippery because they are hard plastic and not rubberized like the other step stools I own. I am not sure why they are made this way. They need rubberized feet because on a hard floor a small push from the side will make it move. I might try to add some rubberized feet.
customer_reviews.author: P89ybb02

customer_reviews.title: Love keeping as independent as can be
customer_reviews.text: Given my body is severely disabled needing a relator to ambulate around, plus a fall risk with nerve damage to lower legs post-op spinal surgery, this has given me some independence as a 4" 8" little old gal. I use my body [not just hands as most would do] to open it and very carefully climb up and down enabling me to reach the other wise impossible. Love keeping as independent as can be! Guess I'm become a bit eccentric. If my family/friends saw me do this they would indeed say I was taking an awful chance and I'd agree with them! I feel safe on this equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix B.

customer_reviews.title: The best ladder
customer_reviews.text: Love this ladder bought it as a newly divorced woman to do small jobs around my home. Its very light weight and sturdy. It can hold a lot of weight. I think the instructions say no more than 250 but my 300 pound neighboot claimed it with no problem never once did we think it would break. It folds up and fits in a tiny spot in my garage. Best purchase ever!
customer_reviews.author: Andie

customer_reviews.title: I cannot begin to explain how awesome this is to have the tray/platform
customer_reviews.text: I have a few two and three-set ladders at home, and they are just "ok" to use. When I was looking at this unit to purchase, I was drawn to the fact that this has a tray/platform for tools and items. I cannot begin to explain how awesome this is to have the tray/platform. In fact, I have started using the tray when I am doing projects even when I don't have to use the ladder. It is a great height, and it holds whatever I need when doing projects.
customer_reviews.author: A. Van

customer_reviews.title: Perfect stepladder at a perfect price!
customer_reviews.text: We needed to replace our ancient wooden stepladder before it killed someone. This is perfect! Nice and sturdy with the kind of legs and lock in place as soon as you put your weight on the first step. It's got the little top tray to hold tools or a light bulb or whatever. It's lightweight and folds up easily for storage. Also, the price was hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: kkalico

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, tall, long-lasting
customer_reviews.text: This step-stool has been used almost weekly for more than six years. I have painted many rooms, changed light bulbs and smoke detector batteries, hung Christmas lights, changed the windshield wipers on my van, etc etc etc. It's fantastic! Easy to carry when folded. Easy to fold and unfold. Nice tray to set a can of paint or tools within easy reach. Tall enough for me to reach a 10-foot ceiling. Very sturdy. I expect it to last for decades.
customer_reviews.author: MamaLama

customer_reviews.title: Very safe ladder to use.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed. The stepladder I have had for years is too short and too dangerous to use to reach ceiling fans and light bulbs. I could have fallen while replacing a light bulb a few days ago. I don’t want to break my hip the next time I need to replace another light bulb. This new latter is clearly a vast improvement over the last one. I feel very safe using this one.
customer_reviews.author: Cal B.

customer_reviews.title: Great for short people
customer_reviews.text: Im very short and i just happened to have an apartment with cabinets so high i cant reach *sigh*. So i had to get a ladder. This works great! Ive used it for lil projects and its helpful to have a shelf so you can put screws and what not on it. Folding is a little but weird so had to adjust to that( you pull s handle) also its a bit ridged so i wouldnt say you have alot of maneuverability with it. But it works and the price was decent
customer_reviews.author: tessla varvel

customer_reviews.title: WIDE TREADS WON'T TIRE FEET, AMPLE TRAY TO HOLD ITEMS BUT IT SLIDES
customer_reviews.text: This exceeded my expectations. The tray has indented circles for gallon cans, and other indents and holes to hold misc. items while you are on the ladder. I LOVE everything about this ladder, but for the fact it will slide on smooth flooring, so you need to be aware of that prior to climbing on. This is why it only has 4 and not stars
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Step!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect size and weight for small jobs inside and outside around my house. It gave me perfect balance and I felt very secure doing some light painting and installing lighting. Being able to place both feet on the step gave me better balance. I am 60 years old and not in the best of shape, so balance is not as strong in order to use a regular ladder. I do not have to hire someone to change light bulbs or do small jobs around the house. Great price, secure and it was delivered as promised.
customer_reviews.author: Josie M

customer_reviews.title: Safe, Secure
customer_reviews.text: Safe and secure. For 5' 2" woman, now I can change light bulbs in ceiling fixtures safely, and feeling secure. It is heavy. That's the good thing. Also the bad thing if you are older and small. Answer to that? Just move it slowly. A bit at a time. Remember, that weight is one of the things that makes it secure and safe. And I love the nice broad steps. No more killing my arches, my whole foot fits on the step. I recommend this step ladder.
customer_reviews.author: KerryBee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sturdy ladder
customer_reviews.text: Excellent ladder, nice large steps and feels very sturdy. The only issue I have with this item is the piece of plastic on the top handle was broken, which happened during manufacturing. I know this because the screw that was hold this in place was bent and broken inside the plastic. Since the screw sits flush against the bar I know it didn't happen during shipping, plus the box was not damaged. I will try to deal with Cosco to see if they will resolve this issue without sending it back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Brian LaCount

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, even for big boys
customer_reviews.text: I am a creature of habit. I found this ladder years ago at my local hardware store, and I loved it. It folds down very slim, which is important to me. It is very sturdy, and not too heavy. I weigh about 200 lbs. I have a co-worker who is about 260 lbs. It is still sturdy enough for him. I finally wore my first ladder, after 3 years of constant daily use, (I repair garage doors 50 hours a week). I went back to my hardware store, and they no longer carried this ladder. I panicked, because I was so accustomed to this ladder and it's tray/tool slots. I found it on Amazon though, and ordered 2 new ones.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Thankyou!
customer_reviews.text: It's a ladder that I use to reach my highest cabinets. I don't close it because it can be tedious for as much as I use it. It's modern design pair well with the black and silver look in kitchen appliances. I could've bought any other ladder for inside and outside the house small chores. This one is perfectly fit for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kiva Johnson-Hatcher

customer_reviews.title: Great Step ladder
customer_reviews.text: I love this step ladder. I am a senior woman and it is easy to carry and set up. It is very sturdy, solid, and the steps are very wide so you feel secure on the ladder. The tray at the top is perfect for holding small items so you do not have to go up and down when doing chores. Great ladder for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Bow Wow Trainer

customer_reviews.title: Best ladder/platform I have found for interior work
customer_reviews.text: Awesome ladder/work platform. I have bought several step ladders and regular ladders over the years as both a landlord and business owner (ie, I do a lot of unpaid handyman work). And this is by far the most useful and versatile of the bunch. It is lightweight, deploys quickly, is stable and gives you plenty of space to work. The third step means your arms aren't as far overhead and don't get as tired.
customer_reviews.author: htlcrtk

customer_reviews.title: and i can reach and work high up comfortably and the deep steps give me a sure footing
customer_reviews.text: This is the most convenient ladder i have ever used. I am under five feet tall, and i can reach and work high up comfortably and the deep steps give me a sure footing. No more sore feet!!! And this ladder comes with a work station tray at the top. I love this thing. And it folds flat - in a snap!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well and safe
customer_reviews.text: Works well and easy to close, the bottom feet fall off something but clip back on easily enough, the lock mechanism is good for safety and the integrated storage step holds paint cans very well with recessed holes to avoid movement. No complaints so far
customer_reviews.author: MR

customer_reviews.title: Love this ladder
customer_reviews.text: Probably one of the best purchases I've made in a long time. I'm 80 years old and had no problem carrying it up a flight of 18 stairs. Easy to open and close. Just the right size to get to top shelves of my cabinets. Highly recommend this to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene Williams

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected and I had high expectations!
customer_reviews.text: Has a great tray for holding paint cans or other items. Perfect height for trimming in ceilings/tops of walls. Easy to move and stance is not overly wide allowing access in corners. Sturdy with comfortable wide steps. Excellent pads provide great protection for you floor and solid footing for the "step ladder"
customer_reviews.author: Stratman

customer_reviews.title: Great stepstool
customer_reviews.text: We saw this at a cottage we rented, so ordered it when we arrived home. It is so sturdy, an excellent height for your around the house projects A little stiff to fold and unfold but folded up, stores very well. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: myvoteisgood

customer_reviews.title: It's fairly heavy to move around, but I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: This ladder is the absolute best for putting in ceiling fixtures. handy tool holders and tray spots for hardware. I freaking love it. It's really good for painting also, but its weight and size poses a problem for my wife at times. We bought a second one for a housewarming gift...Nobody should be without one!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica A Beem

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy & Safe
customer_reviews.text: This quality of this ladder is top notch. It is sturdy, easy to open and close. I do wish it was a bit taller. The down side is the weight of it but I have limited ability to lift things. I would purchase this ladder again. I feel safe stepping up on it.
customer_reviews.author: Williams

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as Shown
customer_reviews.text: Love this ladder. Love Cosco brand produces. Been a loyal customer since buying a bab carrier 40+ years ago. When given a choice of products, I always go with Cosco. This is a smaller ladder with wide base and work shelf. Perfect for holding my drill, screwdrivers, paint can or tray. This ladder was sold and shipped by Amazon. I received it two days before promised. Thank you Amazon. Previous tall ladder sold and shipped by a California company was received damaged. Never could get customer service. Thanks again Amazon..
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Mama

customer_reviews.title: IF YOU CONPLAIN ABOUT THIS LADDER YOU WILL COMPLAIN ABOUT ANYTHING!!!!
customer_reviews.text: If you don't set this ladder someplace ridiculous you couldn't ask for sturdier place to work from. For those who haven't seen one of these ladders, I would recommend that you check them out, if you see one it will sell itself.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald C. Parker

customer_reviews.title: MADE STURDY AND MORE THAN A STEP LADDER
customer_reviews.text: I have had this ladder for about 4 months now and I like it very much. I like it because of the handle at the top to hold onto, the steps are wider to provide a more stable standing platform and I like the work tray to place all my project tools onto. The fact that this ladder holds up to 250 pounds is a bonus you won't find in other "step" ladders. I would recommend this ladder to friends and family. I am 67 year old woman and I feel very confident when stepping onto this ladder. Of course, I step onto it slowly.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Cisco Platform Step Ladder
customer_reviews.text: This one of the safest step ladders I have ever owned and used. I really appreciate the large platform steps for each step. This is my 2nd Cisco step ladder. I keep one in my basement and the other one in my garage. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: rcwall

customer_reviews.title: sturdy but caution on hard floors
customer_reviews.text: It does the job, helps change lightbulbs at 10ft ceiling height, but BEWARE, It will easily slip on wood floors. I may try to find some rubber feet for it because it is actually very dangerous on our floors, until then will only use when someone else is there to steady it and keep it from moving
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin allen

customer_reviews.title: Steps are a little flimsy, but I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: Not to shabby. I'm happy with the price, but the steps are a LITTLE to flimsy. I have a rubbermaid that is built like a tank, but its not as high and doesn't have some of the cool features this one has. Still, I am happy with it and you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Lino412

customer_reviews.title: A great step ladder with handles to climb.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this step ladder. Its taller than the usual 3 step. It has handles to help you climb and is sturdy when climbing. My legs are weak so I have to hold on to something when using steps. This step ladder makes it easy for me to use. It also has a tray to hold tools and/or paint. It is a little heavy, but that helps it feel sturdy. I would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. M. Helfand

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY FOUND WHAT I WAS LOOKING FOR!
customer_reviews.text: I love this ladder. I am a 5'5" 142lb woman and I can carry it around easily. I bought it because I was painting old kitchen cabinets and needed a ladder but I didn't want a "Man Ladder". They just take up too much space. This also has a paint tray on it and the top handle allowed me to hold on and lean to reach corners while still feeling perfectly secure. I took it outside to wash windows on the ground floor. Traction on each of the 3 treads and reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: Mick

customer_reviews.title: Solid, good ladder
customer_reviews.text: This is a great piece of equipment. It is very solid, easy to move and has nice wide steps which is so much easier on the feet when standing on the rungs for long periods of time. There is a tray on the front that is perfect for holding any shape of paint container without taking a chance of it falling off.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy T

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper materials
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these about 8 years ago. Love love love it Company has reduced the quality of metal and plastic throughout. Although the price had gone up 25%. If fact the rubber feet are now cheap plastic that slip instead of grip. Going to add a Non slip pad for safety. The size is perfect for tons of jobs. It's new so can't say how durability is.
customer_reviews.author: GARDENS

customer_reviews.title: Helps you stay stable when you climb and work.
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and almost easy for an elderly weak woman to carry. Extended handrails make it very secure for said elderly woman to climb. The steps are wide and the top non-step holding platform has a little curve in the front so you can lean forward for balance and it will support your legs. About the 'almost easy' to carry and move - I wish they would put little wheels on the legs that work like children's shoes - they go up into the shoe so kid can walk safely but come down for kid to 'wheel' around. I am hoping the manufacturer will read this review and add this feature.
customer_reviews.author: rhody

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: The design and quality is excellent and it's an excellent value. Yes, it's made of steel and for that reason it's heavier than aluminum models but that weight is not burdensome. The criticism voiced by some here that the feet slide on certain surfaces is asinine. Should you find yourself in such a situation, then simply place something appropriate on the floor. But I've used this on hardwood floor with no problems whatsoever. Further since the ladder is fully self-supporting it is unlikely that you will ever generate any lateral loads that would cause the ladder to slide. Ignore the naysayers as they either have an agenda or are simply stupid.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Skier

customer_reviews.title: What a ladder!
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I needed. It is everything it says and more. I feel safe when I use it to change light bulbs, clean ceiling fans, dust walls, clean windows, and more. You will love it too.
customer_reviews.author: online shopper

customer_reviews.title: Very useful and a quality product
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this ladder all over the house and trying to find excuses to use it. It's sturdy, just tall enough that I'm not afraid of falling to my death and the tray is my favorite part. So handy
customer_reviews.author: Olivia A

customer_reviews.title: Step Stool Ladder
customer_reviews.text: The step stool is excellent tool. I would recommend every homeowner purchasing. I prefer the three steps over two step, so you're able to reach high spots without requiring the use of a ladder. The stool is very sturdy and has been used for everything from household chores to painting.
customer_reviews.author: Jon B

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a great product.
customer_reviews.text: Can't believe I didn't grab this earlier. Ugh. I've been working with a broken down heavy steel ladder - and this was a great replacement. Easy to carry, reaches higher than I thought, very stable and a great platform for tools/paint/etc. Stairs are wide/deep enough for a confident climb.
customer_reviews.author: Beth c.

customer_reviews.title: A Good Safety Tool
customer_reviews.text: I use this to a great effect in the kitchen. I'm 75 yrs old and I truly need the higher rail over the steps because I need something to give me extra balance when I climb to the tops of the dish and pan cabinets. Step stools do not give me that steadiness. The light weight of the ladder allows me to store it on the inside of the pantry closet in the kitchen. Naturally, I use it for more than that: Changing light bulbs in the ceilings; Cleaning the tops of the freezer and refrigerator; Regular indoor do-it-yourself work; etc.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Richter Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Step width and sturdiness.
customer_reviews.text: Great step width for a feeling of security and confidence when reaching high items or work areas.
customer_reviews.author: Norman L. Townsend

customer_reviews.title: As expected from COSCO
customer_reviews.text: In my family, Cosco items have been sturdy and reliable products for "many" years. Safely reaching the top of my cabinets and windows is a must as I get older. Quality item for a reasonable price. Glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Sedonartist

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and useful small ladder with easy storage
customer_reviews.text: Had comparable small ladder for 14-15 years and finally wore it out. Bought this to replace it, and it’s as convenient and durable as the old one. I looked at some that didn’t have the shelf at the top and wouldn’t consider them. You need the shelf for tools, cleaners, paper towels, even bottled water. It folds pretty flat, too, for easy storage.
customer_reviews.author: Trina Schoonmaker

customer_reviews.title: Perfect ladder!
customer_reviews.text: I am only 5ft tall and I have 10ft ceilings in my house. This is perfect to reach cupboards and ceiling fans and higher shelves. It is lightweight and easy to carry around the house. It stores nicely and does not take up much room. Perfect for all sorts of chores. I don't know how I lived without it.
customer_reviews.author: Jrich

customer_reviews.title: Great VALUE!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best small ladder we have owned. Large steps makes it easy on your feet with repeated climbing. Especially when painting. Lightweight, sturdy, easily stored in a small space, very stable, greater older adults.
customer_reviews.author: judy

customer_reviews.title: Great Ladder
customer_reviews.text: I bought this ladder based upon Amazon reviews and other independent reviews. It's a great ladder for almost every job because it's relatively light weight and has the benefit of the tray for tools, paint, etc. Most smaller step ladders don't have this feature. It's sturdy but does have a little sliding on my wood floors and that's the reason for the lower rating. My husband thinks it's a great buy and some workmen we've hired have used it and plan on purchasing one for themselves. I've heard that there is some type of adhesive or non-slip spray which I will look into but want to make sure it's not abrasive and scratch flooring.
customer_reviews.author: jjbk

customer_reviews.title: Strong, Sturdy & Safe
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this step ladder for my elderly mother to use around her home. It grips well to carpeting as well as tile, wood and concrete floors. The hand hold at the top provides a good grip to steady anyone while balancing on any of the three steps. It is light enough to move around, but heavy enough to support anyone of average weight (see item specifications for weight limits.) The small platform holds tools, cleaning accessories, etc. Folds away easily for storage. I would highly recommend this step ladder to any age group, but find it particularly helpful to the elderly and those who have balance issues.
customer_reviews.author: wcmissions

customer_reviews.title: wide steps, tall handle and stable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this years ago because of the wider steps and top shelf to hold paint or tools or whatever. Plus a taller handle. it has a solid locking system and is very stable. I am 100 pct happy with it. It's not short like a little household latter and not the taller A frame type latters so its easy to move around both inside and outside the house. I love it so much I ordered one for my mom who loves it too, again for the wider steps and stability. A must have for everybody.
customer_reviews.author: Sheree

customer_reviews.title: Best ladder ever
customer_reviews.text: This ladder is perfect. I just painted the dining room with it. I have rheumatoid arthritis, and flat feet. The normal thin ladder rungs absolutely kill my feet, and I end up with major leg and back pain after a short period. The full platforms make all the difference, and I love the stability bar at the top. It's also light enough for me to manage by myself, and stable enough that I feel secure while painting. I wish I had bought this years ago. I still have 2 rooms which need painting, and this ladder is the only way I'll be able to do them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well-built and sturdy, but heavy to carry
customer_reviews.text: This is a well-built step ladder. It's very sturdy and seems very safe. My only complaint is that it is heavy for me to carry. I'm not the "iron woman" that I used to be, and I prefer lighter frames to easily move from one floor to another floor if need be.
customer_reviews.author: J. P.

customer_reviews.title: Great for Granny!!!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best purchases I have made! After reading all of the reviews, I selected this ladder. Being almost 60, my kids (all over 30) were constantly nagging me about lugging around my little two-step ladder to replace light bulbs, smoke detector batteries, etc, since I have been blessed with being a little clumsey sometimes, taking unnecessary risks. This solved my problem. Lightweight enough for me to handle, sturdy, solid and with great wide steps. The upper handle is great to hold on to to provide that extra stability I need. Thank you to all of you reviewers who helped me make my decision to be safer alone in my home.
customer_reviews.author: B. Fritz

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: This is an absolutely fantastic ladder! I was worried that it was slightly overpriced when I purchased it but now I'm glad I spent the money. It's sturdy and very stable and it was ready to use right out of the box. It's also light and relatively easy to transport. It fits in my sedan easily. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It opens and closes easily and is sturdy for changing light bulbs and other small tasks. I am afraid of heights but can climb all the way up because of the handle. The attached tray makes doing chores easier since I don't have to hold anything.
customer_reviews.author: Sandi S

customer_reviews.title: HEAVY DUTY & STEADY
customer_reviews.text: I was searching for a step ladder that was a little taller than the one I had, but more stable. This was the one!! This ladder stands taller than others I have looked at. The handle extends high above the top step, which allows you to have a handle to hold onto when getting up and down. My older joints does not allow quick action on stairs and steps. I have no worries on this ladder. The legs are wide apart with wide front feet and the bar across the back legs, allowing for great stability. This is a very nice step ladder for a reasonable price. I am happy with this purchase and I highly recommend this to others!
customer_reviews.author: CHERYL

customer_reviews.title: GREAT GREAT STEP LADDER
customer_reviews.text: One of my very best purchases. Sturdy and a great size for doing things around the house/ I am 5'4" tall and mostly everything is out of my reach.
customer_reviews.author: empi

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Wait
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this thinking it would be safer than having a ladder in the house for, ceiling lights you need changed or the painting you have to do. This 3 stepper is wonderful, wide steps for easy standing for periods of time, the construction is excellent, folds very easily for putting away. Wish we would have ordered it earlier like years earlier! Must have been a popular item this year, we were told that it would be here a specific day and it took 2 extra days before it was delivered here.
customer_reviews.author: Bargain Shopper

customer_reviews.title: SLIDES ON KITCHEN TILE FLOORS
customer_reviews.text: Ladder is solid and well made, the only problem I had was that most of what I needed it for was in the kitchen area , and it side on my tile floors. Had to return.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Beltran

customer_reviews.title: You will love this!
customer_reviews.text: I have seen these ladders for $80+ elsewhere. Being an older couple, it's difficult to find ladders with wide enough steps that are not just a two step step ladder, which is good for somethings but not for those taller cabinets or ceiling fans. I have a little vertigo, and I feel quite secure on this ladder. I really love Amazon Prime...$40 and free shipping, what's not to love?
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: Nice and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sturdy. I have 10' ceilings and am 5'10". If I stand on my tippy toes while wearing shoes I can change a lightbulb, barely. If you are looking for this in a 10' ceiling house get a 4 step.
customer_reviews.author: Izzy

customer_reviews.title: It will last
customer_reviews.text: This one was a gift for my handy man. I have one similar to this one same brand. I purchased 10+ years ago. It store easy. great value
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: okay sorry had to get that out my system i am in LOVE with this ladder HUGE STURDY STEPS
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT HESITATE ....... BUY THIS . okay sorry had to get that out my system i am in LOVE with this ladder HUGE STURDY STEPS. im a contractor and this ladder is a lot bigger than the pic shows. prob not good for elders as its a little heavy to carry around home but for handy people just WOW .... EIGHT STARS IF I COULD LOL... btw that top portion is great and huge for holding tools phone keys paint drill etc... must have item!!!
customer_reviews.author: strak liranian

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding ladder
customer_reviews.text: This is an outstanding letter. I have utilize it for well over a year in a commercial application, as well as for home use. This ladder is as tight today is the day it was shipped to me. Highly recommend it to anyone who needs a strong, durable, well-made ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Ladder!
customer_reviews.text: This ladder is awesome for reaching the double-stacked kitchen cupboards in our 9' ceiling kitchen. Wide steps for stability climbing and a tray at the top to give you a spot for tools or items being put up or removed from those cupboards. It's also relatively flat when folded close - which is an easy process of lifting a handle. Plus it weighs less than 18 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Loikalani

customer_reviews.title: It is high enought
customer_reviews.text: The Height is great its easy to fold but a little hard to open. It may loosen up with more use,I have only used it four time so far
customer_reviews.author: ajay

customer_reviews.title: Used 5 days a week and holds up no problem
customer_reviews.text: I use this step ladder basically every day I work which is 5 days a week, 8-12 hours a day. I do residential service on garage doors so I am constantly using tools and carrying things with me on this ladder and it never budges. I am 6'2 215 lbs and I've been using it this way for almost 6 months now and it shows no signs of losing durability. Overall great purchase
customer_reviews.author: Taylor K.

customer_reviews.title: Just what we were looking for
customer_reviews.text: We had looked all over for a ladder like this & couldn't find it locally (small town in the mountains). We had a 2-step ladder, but that extra step on this one makes a huge difference. And the bar across the top gives you an extra measure of safety for something to hold on to. Heavy duty, but still easy to store away. Amazon delivered it promptly & in great shape. Just what we were looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Justa Girl

customer_reviews.title: Support and Functionality
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely a joy to own over my previous step-stool. It's very light and easy to handle, but more importantly, being over 60, i so enjoy feeling more safe with the grab bar at the top. I'm still very active and do lots of home improvement projects, but this step stool just gives me the added support and comfort level. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: CeCe

customer_reviews.title: Nice Step Ladder
customer_reviews.text: I really like this step ladder mainly because the steps are wider than most step ladders making me feel safer using it. Also has a nice shelf/tray to put things on that you might need for your project.
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: Way heavier than I need and I'm not getting a ...
customer_reviews.text: Way heavier than I need and I'm not getting a response when I told them I wanted to return this. It was Sunday so I understand but it's Monday and still getting the run around. Just send me information to return this item. It's in the original box and never used.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Great ladder
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace my old short ladder. This one is easy to open and close. It is lighter than the older one and has a nice work shelf at the top of the ladder. It has a 225 pound rating which is 25 pounds more than most models of other ladders. There is one small drawback for me. The ladder closes up so tight that I can no longer hook the ladder on to the plastic hanger that the old ladder hung on for so many years. I have not found a new way of hanging the ladder is conveniently as the old way..
customer_reviews.author: dennisal

customer_reviews.title: Best indoor ladder for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Very deep (like a stair step) steps, very stable. I'm 5'10'' and if I stand on the third step, I have to duck in order to not hit standard 8' ceiling. Cons: Steel *frame*, but not steps. My guess is it would not hold up well if stored in a cold outdoor environment, but *duh*, it's an indoor ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality for the $
customer_reviews.text: Great step stool for the price! Didn’t pay attention to the product dimensions so it was larger than we were expecting but perfect for reaching regular sized ceilings without having to stretch to reach.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Kreitzman

customer_reviews.title: Love this ladder
customer_reviews.text: Took a lot of online shopping to find a ladder that would give me the height I need to get stuff done in the house that could also support my weight without concerning myself with breaking the ladder or a step on the ladder and falling to my doom. This was the one, and saved me from trying to find some industrial work ladder parallel. The ladder provides good support, has a good grip though it is plastic and does not have rubber on the feet so I wouldn't use this in inclement weather I've only used it indoors, and provides good height.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Great little ladder
customer_reviews.text: A lot to like about this little step ladder. The depth of the steps, plenty of tool storage, sturdy, and folds compactly.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Watson

customer_reviews.title: Best three step stepladder you'll ever use.
customer_reviews.text: Best three step stepladder you'll ever use. This baby is sturdy and has both a well-placed hand hold plus a very convenient tray. Rock steady. After using one for 5 or 6 years, I've purchased two more for use at two other locations.
customer_reviews.author: Al Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great product has made my life so easy with all ...
customer_reviews.text: We renovated whole hose with bead board wood trim and new wood doors and frames. I spend my life painting sanding and staining. This ladder holds all my odd tools plus paint pans or cans etc. I organize on the top shelf and work for hours moving ladder by myself. Its stable when moving with paint and tools. I have spend many hours on this and every step along the way have never felt unsafe. I use highest step for ceiling high detail work. Great product has made my life so easy with all this work.would by again.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Ann Hansell

customer_reviews.title: It's a good item, but not superb
customer_reviews.text: It's a good item, but not superb. It does not seem very sturdy. Granted, it has a great design with deep steps and a working platform, yet I don't feel secure climbing the steps when the ladder is resting on hard surfaces. The feet on the bottom are plastic, not rubber, so they slip and slide. Not very reassuring. (As a point of reference, I weigh 135lbs.) I would give this item 4 stars if the feet were rubber.
customer_reviews.author: JA

customer_reviews.title: Greatly improved!
customer_reviews.text: I had the same one 20 years ago, and am now amazed at how much it is improved. Feel very safe and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. M

customer_reviews.title: Perfect price and lightwreight.
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for getting up in my closet with, I am a shorty and cant reach anything so I keep this in my closet, or behind the door to reach my shoes at the top of the closet. Very lightweight so easy to move around the house as needed. I just wish I wouldve realized the top is not a stair but instead a paint bucket holder, I still stand on it anyway although I realize this is dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: LoriS

customer_reviews.title: Great ladder
customer_reviews.text: Great ladder size. I use it mostly for Inside house painting. Handy for reaching on top of cabinets also!
customer_reviews.author: Melody Creech

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Ladder/Stool
customer_reviews.text: very mobile, versatile, looked along time for a handy ladder like this , nice deep tray for spills, tools don't fall off ,
customer_reviews.author: TwistedGrip

customer_reviews.title: Works well for fly fishing!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to flyfish Pyramid Lake. It's sturdy enough to not twist when you cast, and not too heavy to haul between the truck and the beach. The feet could me modified to not sink into the sand, but that's a small issue.
customer_reviews.author: Pocket Water

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and not to high or heavy
customer_reviews.text: I needed a ladder taller than a two step stool and shorter than a six foot ladder with a tool/parts tray. This fits that big stool, small ladder space perfectly. Well built and sturdy with a stable footing, the weight reflects those characteristics but does not overwhelm. Tool tray is an excellent companion adding much utility for completing a job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It can also handle close to 200lb weights easily. Love it
customer_reviews.text: Light enough to be carried from room to room and tall enough to get short me to the ceiling. (I'm 5'.1"). Doesn't scratch my wooden floors, and doesn't slid away when you try to step on it. It can also handle close to 200lb weights easily. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica A. Marrast

customer_reviews.title: Great ladder, easy on the feet.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this identical ladder before and had to leave it behind when I moved. I love the big wide steps and the large, several inches deep, tray that has holes for assorted tools and indentations that help hold a quart or gallon of paint without it slipping around. I am older and have arthritis and feel very secure on these large steps and having the security of the bar at the top to help steady myself. The lighter weight is a bonus in moving it around easily. As long as Cosco makes this ladder I will never be without one.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Step Ladder
customer_reviews.text: We own a higher cost brand and this product was less expensive and every bit as sturdy as the more expensive step ladder. I do recommend this step ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Rudylove

product_meta.title: Cosco Three Step Max Steel Work Platform
product_meta.description:
This versatile work platform can be used for many different big and small household projects and is so durable. Whatever the task, cleaning windows, painting, or repair projects it will provide you with many years of use

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Max work platform features a large platform top step, an extended grip handle and a deluxe molded utility tray for maximum comfort while completing your task.
feature_bullets: EASY TO USE - Easily folds with the one-hand lock/release latch
CONVENIENT - Project trays include slots for tools, paint, and other project materials
STABLE AND SECURE - Large platform step with slip-resistant tread design, and slip-resistant feet
SAFETY - Meets ANSI standards for Type II Medium Household Workload Duty Rating 225 lbs

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars1,205 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
